item.title: BMAD Method v6.0.0-alpha.23 Upgrade Experience: A Fresh Install Journey
item.content:encoded:
Upgrading BMAD Method from alpha.19 to alpha.23 turned into an unexpected fresh install journey. Here‚Äôs what happened, what changed, and why it might be the right time for you to upgrade too.

The Version Gap Problem

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Version Gap Problem‚Äù

When I ran bunx bmad-method@alpha install, I was greeted with a version warning:

The BMAD team has implemented a sensible stability policy‚Äîonly supporting updates from the previous 2 alpha versions. This prevents accumulation of technical debt and configuration drift.

The Fresh Install Decision

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Fresh Install Decision‚Äù

Given that I was 4 versions behind, the recommended path was clear:

  1. Delete the _bmad/ folder in my project
  2. Run a fresh installation

Benefits of a fresh install:

  • Cleaner configuration without legacy artifacts
  • All new features properly configured
  • Fewer potential conflicts

The alternative (canceling and trying to upgrade anyway) would have risked subtle incompatibilities.

The Installation Process

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Installation Process‚Äù

With BMAD uninstalled, I ran the installer again:

The new alpha.23 installer has several welcome improvements:

1. Comprehensive Module Selection

Section titled ‚Äú1. Comprehensive Module Selection‚Äù

The installer now offers:

  • BMB: BMad Builder (Agent, Workflow, and Module Builder)
  • BMGD: BMad Game Development
  • BMM: BMad Method Agile-AI-Driven-Development
  • CIS: Creative Innovation Suite

2. Enhanced Tool Configuration

Section titled ‚Äú2. Enhanced Tool Configuration‚Äù

I was prompted to configure tools for:

  • Claude Code ‚≠ê
  • Codex, Cursor, GitHub Copilot
  • Google Antigravity, OpenCode, Windsurf
  • And 10+ others (Auggie CLI, Cline, Crush, Gemini CLI, etc.)

3. TTS Support Option

Section titled ‚Äú3. TTS Support Option‚Äù

New in alpha.23: Claude Code TTS (Text-to-Speech) support configuration prompt.

What‚Äôs New in Alpha.23

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New in Alpha.23‚Äù

New Documentation Site

Section titled ‚ÄúNew Documentation Site‚Äù

The installer highlights a brand new documentation resource:

üìö New Docs Site: http://docs.bmad-method.org/

  • Tons of guides and articles coming soon!
  • Everything is free. No paywalls. No gated content.
  • Knowledge should be shared, not sold.

This is a significant community investment‚Äîfree, comprehensive documentation accessible to everyone.

Beta Timeline

Section titled ‚ÄúBeta Timeline‚Äù

According to the installer output:

Stable Beta coming soon - please read the full README.md and linked documentation to get started!

The team is pushing toward beta, with the fresh install requirement expected to be lifted around January 18th.

Community Resources

Section titled ‚ÄúCommunity Resources‚Äù
  • GitHub: https://github.com/bmad-code-org/BMAD-METHOD/
  • YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@BMadCode (Master Class & Podcast launching February 1st!)
  • Changelog: https://github.com/bmad-code-org/BMAD-METHOD/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md

Configuration Improvements

Section titled ‚ÄúConfiguration Improvements‚Äù

The fresh install gave me cleaner configuration:

The installer created:

  • 67 workflows
  • 25 agents
  • 4 tasks
  • 96 files

All properly configured for my chosen tools (claude-code, codex, cursor, github-copilot, antigravity, opencode, windsurf, rovo-dev, auggie, cline, crush, gemini, iflow, kilo, kiro-cli, qwen, roo, trae).

Lessons Learned

Section titled ‚ÄúLessons Learned‚Äù

1. Don‚Äôt Fall Too Far Behind

Section titled ‚Äú1. Don‚Äôt Fall Too Far Behind‚Äù

The alpha.19 ‚Üí alpha.23 gap taught me to stay within 2 versions. This is good practice for any alpha software.

2. Fresh Installs Are Painless

Section titled ‚Äú2. Fresh Installs Are Painless‚Äù

I was worried about losing configuration, but the fresh install was:

  • Fast (~2 minutes)
  • Interactive and clear
  • Resulted in cleaner setup

3. The Community is Growing

Section titled ‚Äú3. The Community is Growing‚Äù

Between the new docs site, upcoming YouTube content, and GitHub activity, BMAD is rapidly evolving. Staying current means access to better tools and patterns.

Recommendation

Section titled ‚ÄúRecommendation‚Äù

If you‚Äôre on alpha.21 or earlier, consider upgrading to alpha.23 now. The fresh install requirement is a small inconvenience for a significantly improved setup.

For teams on alpha.19 or earlier: plan your upgrade before the beta release to avoid more complex migrations later.

Next Steps

Section titled ‚ÄúNext Steps‚Äù

After upgrading, I recommend:

  1. Read the new documentation at docs.bmad-method.org
  2. Explore the 67 newly installed workflows
  3. Try the Quick Dev workflow: /bmad:bmm:workflows:quick-dev
  4. Subscribe to the YouTube channel for the February 1st launch

Resources:

  • BMAD Method Documentation
  • GitHub Repository
  • YouTube Channel
  • Changelog

item.title: BMAD Method Getting Started: A Practical Guide to Quick-Dev Workflows
item.content:encoded:
BMAD Method (Breakthrough Method of Agile AI‚ÄëDriven Development) is an AI-driven development framework that turns ‚Äúrandom prompt hacking‚Äù into a repeatable delivery system.

It does that by packaging:

  • Specialized agents (PM/Architect/Dev/QA/Docs‚Ä¶)
  • Guided workflows (discovery ‚Üí planning ‚Üí execution ‚Üí verification)
  • Living artifacts (briefs, PRDs, stories, checklists)

‚Ä¶so your project context and quality gates live in the repo, not in someone‚Äôs chat history.

1) Features & highlights (what you get)

Section titled ‚Äú1) Features & highlights (what you get)‚Äù

Role-based help instead of ad-hoc prompting

Section titled ‚ÄúRole-based help instead of ad-hoc prompting‚Äù

BMAD provides role personas so you can reliably ask for:

  • a product-level framing (PM)
  • architecture tradeoffs and decisions (Architect)
  • implementation guidance and code changes (Dev)
  • verification and test strategy (QA/Test Architect)
  • documentation and release notes (Tech Writer)

Scale-adaptive planning

Section titled ‚ÄúScale-adaptive planning‚Äù

BMAD is designed to ‚Äúright-size‚Äù the process:

  • Quick Dev / Quick Flow: bug fixes, small features, quick iterations
  • Standard track: medium features/products, PRD ‚Üí architecture ‚Üí stories
  • Enterprise track: governance-heavy environments, stronger gates and traceability

A closed loop from idea to verification

Section titled ‚ÄúA closed loop from idea to verification‚Äù

Instead of generating one-off answers, BMAD encourages a workflow that produces durable artifacts and then uses them to implement and verify.

2) Prerequisites, installation & configuration

Section titled ‚Äú2) Prerequisites, installation & configuration‚Äù

What you‚Äôll need

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat you‚Äôll need‚Äù

BMAD works with any AI coding assistant that supports custom system prompts / project context. Common choices include:

  • Claude Code (CLI)
  • Cursor
  • Windsurf
  • Roo Code (VS Code)
  • GitHub Copilot (VS Code)

Installation (typical)

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation (typical)‚Äù

From your project root (Node.js 20+ recommended), install BMAD into the project (not your home dir) so the config is versionable:

After installation, your repo will contain BMAD modules (agents/workflows/templates). From there you can run workflows from your IDE/assistant.

3) Quick Dev workflow (the ‚Äúfast lane‚Äù)

Section titled ‚Äú3) Quick Dev workflow (the ‚Äúfast lane‚Äù)‚Äù

If your BMAD setup exposes slash commands, you can start here:

If you just want to ship something quickly, the mindset is:

  1. Align on the goal and constraints
  2. Produce a minimal plan / acceptance criteria
  3. Implement with tight verification loops

A practical ‚ÄúQuick Dev‚Äù run looks like:

Step A ‚Äî Define the outcome

Section titled ‚ÄúStep A ‚Äî Define the outcome‚Äù

Write down:

  • What ‚Äúdone‚Äù means (acceptance criteria)
  • Guardrails (what not to change)
  • How you‚Äôll verify (build/tests/manual steps)

Step B ‚Äî Use the workflow to generate lightweight artifacts

Section titled ‚ÄúStep B ‚Äî Use the workflow to generate lightweight artifacts‚Äù

Use the Quick Dev workflow to produce a small set of artifacts that are actually useful during implementation:

  • a short task breakdown
  • an implementation checklist
  • a verification checklist

Step C ‚Äî Execute and verify

Section titled ‚ÄúStep C ‚Äî Execute and verify‚Äù

Have the Dev implement changes and the QA/Test Architect verify with:

  • targeted tests
  • build checks
  • smoke tests

The biggest win is that these outputs are reusable: they become a baseline for the next iteration.

4) Recommended scenarios & daily workflow examples

Section titled ‚Äú4) Recommended scenarios & daily workflow examples‚Äù

Scenario 1 ‚Äî Fix a bug without losing the plot

Section titled ‚ÄúScenario 1 ‚Äî Fix a bug without losing the plot‚Äù

Use Quick Dev to:

  • reproduce the bug
  • add a minimal regression test
  • fix the root cause
  • verify the build

Scenario 2 ‚Äî Add a small feature with predictable scope

Section titled ‚ÄúScenario 2 ‚Äî Add a small feature with predictable scope‚Äù

Use Quick Dev to:

  • clarify edge cases
  • define acceptance criteria
  • implement incrementally
  • validate UX/behavior quickly

Scenario 3 ‚Äî Personal knowledge work (docs, blog posts, learning)

Section titled ‚ÄúScenario 3 ‚Äî Personal knowledge work (docs, blog posts, learning)‚Äù

BMAD isn‚Äôt only for code. A simple pattern:

  • Tech Writer drafts an outline + key sections
  • Dev/Architect validate technical correctness
  • QA proofreads for completeness and broken steps

This is especially effective for ‚Äútutorial + troubleshooting + references‚Äù style posts.

5) Precautions, FAQ & troubleshooting

Section titled ‚Äú5) Precautions, FAQ & troubleshooting‚Äù

‚ÄúThe agent output is too verbose / too shallow‚Äù

Section titled ‚Äú‚ÄúThe agent output is too verbose / too shallow‚Äù‚Äù
  • Ensure your experience level is configured appropriately (expert vs beginner).
  • Use acceptance criteria to constrain the output.
  • Prefer artifacts (brief/spec/story) over free-form chat.

‚ÄúContext is too large / token limits‚Äù

Section titled ‚Äú‚ÄúContext is too large / token limits‚Äù‚Äù

BMAD‚Äôs document sharding and story-driven approach helps. Keep artifacts scoped and feed only what‚Äôs needed to the next role.

‚ÄúMy team doesn‚Äôt want heavy ceremony‚Äù

Section titled ‚Äú‚ÄúMy team doesn‚Äôt want heavy ceremony‚Äù‚Äù

Start with Quick Dev. If it sticks, gradually adopt more planning where it pays off.

6) Collaboration & comparisons

Section titled ‚Äú6) Collaboration & comparisons‚Äù

BMAD is in the same family of ideas as other ‚Äúspec-first / structured prompting‚Äù approaches (e.g., OpenSpec, Spec Kit), but BMAD‚Äôs distinguishing traits are:

  • explicit role personas
  • explicit workflow definitions
  • strong focus on artifact flow and repeatability

7) References

Section titled ‚Äú7) References‚Äù
  • Official docs: https://docs.bmad-method.org/
  • BMAD Method site: https://bmad-method.org
  • GitHub: https://github.com/bmad-code-org/BMAD-METHOD

item.title: HeartPetBond App Launch: GLM 4.7 AI Autonomous Development Passes App Store Review in 2 Days
item.content:encoded:
First of its kind? This may be the first App developed autonomously by domestic GLM 4.7 LLM to pass App Store review and launch.

Review Passed: 2 Days, First Attempt

Section titled ‚ÄúReview Passed: 2 Days, First Attempt‚Äù

Submitted on January 10th, approved on January 12th ‚Äî taking just over 2 days.

If not submitted on a weekend (January 10th was Saturday), the review time might have been even shorter. Compared to the previous MoneyMind App‚Äôs first launch which experienced 14 days, 4 submissions, and 3 rejections, HeartPetBond‚Äôs review process was smooth sailing.

Why Did It Pass on First Try?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy Did It Pass on First Try?‚Äù

Experience Reuse: Learning from MoneyMind‚Äôs Pitfalls

Section titled ‚ÄúExperience Reuse: Learning from MoneyMind‚Äôs Pitfalls‚Äù

Since I had successfully launched MoneyMind App before, I had encountered many pitfalls. This time, I proactively avoided these issues:

  • Screen Compatibility: MoneyMind was rejected for text overlap issues. This time, AI-autonomous testing prioritized verification across different screen sizes
  • Account Deletion: App Store requires account deletion functionality. This time, it was built-in from the start
  • Feature Completeness: Ensured all promoted features work properly, with no ‚Äúcoming soon‚Äù placeholders

Tech Stack: GLM 4.7‚Äôs First App Store Debut

Section titled ‚ÄúTech Stack: GLM 4.7‚Äôs First App Store Debut‚Äù

HeartPetBond was developed autonomously using domestic Zhipu AI‚Äôs GLM 4.7 Large Language Model:

ComponentDescription
Claude CodeBest engineered AI Agent system
GLM 4.7Domestic excellence, extremely cost-effective (200K context, 64K output)
BMAD V6Most powerful AI-driven agile development process
Flutter MCPBest cross-platform development MCP support

Compared to using Opus 4.5 for MoneyMind development, GLM 4.7 costs only about 1/7, but under the BMAD agile process, it‚Äôs fully capable of handling App development tasks.

Project Review: From Idea to Launch

Section titled ‚ÄúProject Review: From Idea to Launch‚Äù

Timeline

Section titled ‚ÄúTimeline‚Äù
  • December 29, 2024: Conceived the HeartPetBond idea (adopted a British Shorthair blue cat)
  • January 10, 2026: Submitted to App Store for review
  • January 12, 2026: Review approved, ready for launch

Development Results

Section titled ‚ÄúDevelopment Results‚Äù
MetricValue
Dart Files62 files
Total Lines of Code15,190 lines
AI Generated Code11,131 lines
Main Pages~10 pages

GLM 4.7: Domestic Model‚Äôs App Store Debut?

Section titled ‚ÄúGLM 4.7: Domestic Model‚Äôs App Store Debut?‚Äù

Could this be the first App developed using GLM 4.7 model to successfully pass App Store review and launch globally?

If so, this would be a milestone for domestic large models in AI autonomous development:

  1. Technical Feasibility Verified: GLM 4.7 is fully capable of handling complex App development tasks
  2. Significant Cost Reduction: Development cost is only 1/7 compared to Opus 4.5
  3. Significantly Improved Efficiency: From idea to App Store launch in just 14 days
  4. Quality Assured: Passing review on first attempt demonstrates code quality and feature completeness meet standards

Core Features: 1-Second Recording, Frictionless Tracking

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Features: 1-Second Recording, Frictionless Tracking‚Äù

HeartPetBond‚Äôs core philosophy is ‚Äú1-Second Recording, Frictionless Tracking‚Äù:

  • Feeding Records: One-tap recording of each feeding
  • Water Changes: Track drinking water replacement
  • Play Time: Record interaction sessions
  • Litter Cleaning: Cleaning frequency reminders
  • Family Collaboration: Whole family participates in pet care together

Key Findings

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Findings‚Äù
  1. Domestic Models Work: While GLM 4.7 is slightly behind Opus 4.5, it‚Äôs fully capable of App development tasks under the BMAD agile process
  2. Experience is Reusable: Learning from MoneyMind‚Äôs review experience made the second App Store submission much smoother
  3. AI Autonomous Development is Mature: From idea to App Store launch, minimal human involvement required
  4. Vibe Coding Era Has Arrived: With good ideas and mature AI toolchains, anyone can quickly turn ideas into reality

Related Reading

Section titled ‚ÄúRelated Reading‚Äù
  • HeartPetBond App: From Adopting a Cat to AI Autonomous Development App Store Submission
  • MoneyMind App Launch: AI Autonomous Development Passes Apple App Store Review
  • Practical Review: Building HeartPetBond App with Claude Code + BMAD + GLM-4.7

Life is compounding. Build your pet emotional bond with AI!

item.title: Weekly Review: AI Autonomous Development - Week 2 - From App Store Launch to Batch Content Production
item.content:encoded:
Core Conclusion: AI autonomous software app development has been validated ‚Äî 1 week for PoC, 2 weeks to submit to App Store. Humans have no advantage in software development execution.

1. App Store Submission and Launch

Section titled ‚Äú1. App Store Submission and Launch‚Äù

This week‚Äôs biggest milestone is successfully validating that Vibe Coding AI-Inspired Programming has achieved a complete closed loop of low-cost, rapid software app development.

MoneyMind App: Published on App Store

Section titled ‚ÄúMoneyMind App: Published on App Store‚Äù

The MoneyMind app has finally passed App Store review and is now globally available.

Key Data:

  • Review Cycle: 14 days, 4 submissions, 3 rejections
  • Code Scale: 89,933 lines of code, 133 files, ~40,000 lines of AI-generated code
  • Human Involvement: Less than 4 hours interacting with AI, 8 hours handling App Store submission, 8 hours writing articles
  • AI Autonomous Running: 100+ hours

HeartPetBond App: Submitted for Review

Section titled ‚ÄúHeartPetBond App: Submitted for Review‚Äù

Building on MoneyMind‚Äôs success, this experiment used the domestic GLM 4.7 model as a cost-effective alternative.

Key Data:

  • Development Cycle: Dec 29 idea ‚Üí Jan 10 submitted to App Store
  • Code Scale: 62 Dart files, 15,190 lines of code
  • Cost Reduction: GLM 4.7 costs about 1/7 of Opus 4.5
  • Tech Stack: Claude Code + GLM 4.7 + BMAD V6 + Flutter MCP

Validation Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúValidation Conclusion‚Äù

1 week for AI autonomous PoC and MVP, from idea to App Store submission. Barring issues, 2 weeks to complete App launch.

2. Batch Publishing WeChat Articles

Section titled ‚Äú2. Batch Publishing WeChat Articles‚Äù

Starting January 4, using Claude Code Skills + GLM 4.7 workflow to automatically collect and write 50+ WeChat articles, now published to WeChat draft box. Each article is manually reviewed before publishing.

Workflow Maturity

Section titled ‚ÄúWorkflow Maturity‚Äù

The workflow is very mature with minimal issues. Two considerations:

1. GLM Pro Subscription 5-Hour Quota

Section titled ‚Äú1. GLM Pro Subscription 5-Hour Quota‚Äù

Parallel Claude Code shells quickly hit GLM API quota limits during batch production, causing content generation interruption.

Solutions:

  • Implement rate limiting or sequential queuing
  • Monitor quota usage to avoid sudden interruption

2. Tedious Manual Review

Section titled ‚Äú2. Tedious Manual Review‚Äù

Manual review of each article takes a few minutes, but with large article counts, it becomes tedious. This is the only remaining manual step and the efficiency bottleneck.

Optimization Directions

Section titled ‚ÄúOptimization Directions‚Äù

Future considerations:

  • AI automatic review mechanism
  • Quality scoring system
  • Auto-publish to official WeChat account

3. AI Autonomous Life Planning

Section titled ‚Äú3. AI Autonomous Life Planning‚Äù

A popular article on X about a foreign female executive using Claude Code for AI autonomous work and life planning.

Reading through it, the main capability is Claude Code‚Äôs engineering and ecosystem. I can do this too ‚Äî and much of my current daily work like rapid app development, batch WeChat article publishing ‚Äî has already been automated via Claude Code.

My Practice

Section titled ‚ÄúMy Practice‚Äù

Compared to the article‚Äôs case:

AreaArticle CaseMy Practice
Software DevelopmentHuman + AI AssistAI autonomous, only provide ideas
Content CreationManual WritingBatch AI generation, 50+/week
PublishingManual OperationAI auto-publish to draft box

Next Step: Package these capabilities as software products for others to use.

4. ‚ÄúAm I Dead?‚Äù App Viral Trend

Section titled ‚Äú4. ‚ÄúAm I Dead?‚Äù App Viral Trend‚Äù

The ‚ÄúAm I Dead?‚Äù (Should I Die?) type apps are viral. Assessment:

Technical Difficulty: Low

Section titled ‚ÄúTechnical Difficulty: Low‚Äù

Using Vibe Coding, let AI autonomously develop apps:

  • 1 week PoC delivery
  • 2 week MVP App Store launch

Risk Points: User Sensitive Information

Section titled ‚ÄúRisk Points: User Sensitive Information‚Äù

Needs careful handling:

  1. Privacy Protection: How to store and transmit user sensitive data
  2. Content Moderation: Responsibility boundaries for AI-generated content
  3. Mental Health: Avoid negative impact on users

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

Technically no difficulty at all. Risks are mainly in user sensitive data acquisition and usage. If developing, need more consideration on product design and legal compliance.

5. AI Autonomous Software Development: Thoughts

Section titled ‚Äú5. AI Autonomous Software Development: Thoughts‚Äù

Humans vs AI: No Contest

Section titled ‚ÄúHumans vs AI: No Contest‚Äù

Currently, humans comparing to AI in software development execution speed, quality, and efficiency ‚Äî completely no advantage.

Humans may still have advantages in:

  • How to propose valuable ideas
  • How to validate ideas have value
  • How to make complex strategic decisions

Future of Software Development

Section titled ‚ÄúFuture of Software Development‚Äù

Software is just an idea. We can propose ideas and let AI autonomously help implement them.

Compared to the internet filled with anxiety, noise, and meaningless arguments, we should calm down and think about the future of software development.

Efficiency Bottlenecks

Section titled ‚ÄúEfficiency Bottlenecks‚Äù

The biggest factors affecting AI autonomous software development efficiency:

  1. Human Involvement ‚Äî As soon as humans participate, execution efficiency drops sharply
  2. Tokens/Cost Limits ‚Äî Also interrupt AI autonomous software development

Future Directions

Section titled ‚ÄúFuture Directions‚Äù

2026 Outlook:

DimensionDirection
BreadthApp/Mini Program/Web + API services, plus games and embedded software
DepthUse OpenCode, GLM 4.7 and other alternative tools
ConcurrencyLet AI parallelly, asynchronously, autonomously advance multiple software projects
IntensityReduce investment and participation in AI technology, maintain appropriate distance from AI tech

6. Weekly Summary

Section titled ‚Äú6. Weekly Summary‚Äù

Key Numbers

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Numbers‚Äù
MetricValue
App Store Published1 (MoneyMind)
App Store Submitted1 (HeartPetBond)
Batch Articles Generated50+
Human Participation Time< 20 hours

Core Insights

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Insights‚Äù
  1. AI Autonomous Development Mature ‚Äî 1 week PoC, 2 weeks App Store launch
  2. Significant Cost Reduction ‚Äî GLM 4.7 alternative at 1/7 cost
  3. Humans Are Efficiency Bottleneck ‚Äî Reducing human participation is key to improving efficiency
  4. Ideas Over Execution ‚Äî Software is just an idea, let AI autonomously implement

Life is compounding. Let AI develop autonomously, let ideas land quickly.

item.title: HeartPetBond App: From Adopting a Cat to AI-Driven App Development Submitted to App Store
item.content:encoded:
TL;DR: Using the Chinese LLM GLM 4.7 with Claude Code + BMAD V6 + Flutter MCP, fully autonomous AI development from idea to App Store submission in just 12 days. The project contains 62 Dart files with 15,190 lines of code.

Part 1: The Beginning ‚Äî A British Shorthair Blue Cat

Section titled ‚ÄúPart 1: The Beginning ‚Äî A British Shorthair Blue Cat‚Äù

Recently, my family and I adopted a British Shorthair blue cat. Every day is filled with feeding, watering, playing, and cleaning the litter box ‚Äî we‚Äôre having a blast!

While caring for this fluffy little companion, an idea came to me: What if there was an app to record family members‚Äô interactions with the cat ‚Äî feeding, exercise, playtime, and more? This would not only help track the cat‚Äôs health but also let the whole family participate in pet care together, strengthening our emotional bonds.

Part 2: Technology Stack ‚Äî Standing on the Shoulders of Giants

Section titled ‚ÄúPart 2: Technology Stack ‚Äî Standing on the Shoulders of Giants‚Äù

Why GLM 4.7?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy GLM 4.7?‚Äù

In the Vibe Coding (AI autonomous development) space, the technology has become quite mature. Previously, I used Claude Code + Opus 4.5 + BMAD V6 + Flutter MCP to let AI autonomously develop a MoneyMind App. The entire development process took only 8 hours of interaction with AI, and it has been successfully approved and published on the App Store.

Recently, Chinese AI company Zhipu released their latest GLM 4.7 large language model:

  • Context Window: 200K Tokens (same as Claude Code‚Äôs model)
  • Maximum Output: 64K Tokens
  • Price Advantage: Much cheaper than Opus 4.5
  • Performance: According to community reviews, slightly behind Opus 4.5 but with excellent cost-effectiveness

Since Vibe Coding for autonomous app development is now mature, cost-effective, fast, and requires almost no human involvement ‚Äî with AI generating UI and completing automated test verification throughout ‚Äî I decided to run another experiment: Can Zhipu‚Äôs GLM 4.7 model (from the recently Hong Kong-listed company) also quickly develop an app and submit it to the App Store?

The Golden Combination

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Golden Combination‚Äù

Thanks to this powerful tech stack:

ComponentDescription
Claude CodeBest-in-class AI Agent system with powerful toolchain and ecosystem
GLM 4.7Chinese AI excellence, highly cost-effective LLM (Opus 4.5 alternative)
BMAD V6Most powerful AI-driven agile development workflow + full SDLC management
Flutter MCPBest MCP support for cross-platform development framework

Part 3: Development Process ‚Äî Fully Autonomous AI Development

Section titled ‚ÄúPart 3: Development Process ‚Äî Fully Autonomous AI Development‚Äù

Having already successfully developed the MoneyMind App, this AI development process was even smoother.

Step 1: Environment Setup

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 1: Environment Setup‚Äù

First, configure the development environment:

  1. Claude Code: AI Agent runtime environment
  2. GLM 4.7: Connected via Zhipu API
  3. BMAD V6: Agile development workflow framework
  4. Flutter MCP: Flutter development toolchain

Step 2: Initialize Project

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 2: Initialize Project‚Äù

BMAD automatically scans project status and generates an analysis report, confirming this as a new Greenfield project.

Step 3: Create Product Brief

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 3: Create Product Brief‚Äù

Based on my simple idea, AI automatically generated a complete product definition:

  • Product Name: HeartPetBond
  • Target Users: Pet-owning families/couples
  • Tech Stack: Flutter + GetX + Drift
  • Core Philosophy: 1-second recording, frictionless tracking

Step 4: Enter Quick Flow Dev Mode

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 4: Enter Quick Flow Dev Mode‚Äù

Selected Quick Flow Dev mode ‚Äî BMAD‚Äôs rapid development flow that doesn‚Äôt require generating and maintaining verbose documentation, letting AI focus on code generation and testing.

Step 5: Fully Autonomous Development

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 5: Fully Autonomous Development‚Äù

Enter the magic command:

If Claude Code execution interrupts, just enter this command again to resume. AI autonomously completes:

  • üìù Requirements analysis and user story breakdown
  • üé® UI design and Widget tree construction
  • üíª Business logic implementation
  • üß™ Integration test generation and verification
  • üîß Bug fixes and code optimization

Part 4: Project Results

Section titled ‚ÄúPart 4: Project Results‚Äù

Timeline

Section titled ‚ÄúTimeline‚Äù
  • December 29, 2024: HeartPetBond idea conceived
  • January 10, 2026: Submitted to App Store, awaiting review

Code Metrics

Section titled ‚ÄúCode Metrics‚Äù
MetricValue
Dart Files62
Total Lines of Code15,190
AI-Generated Code11,131 lines
Main Pages~10

Core Feature Pages

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Feature Pages‚Äù

Part 5: Summary and Reflections

Section titled ‚ÄúPart 5: Summary and Reflections‚Äù

This experiment largely achieved its goals: Even with the budget-friendly GLM 4.7 model, AI can autonomously develop a complete app. I only provided the initial idea, and the rest ‚Äî design, coding, testing ‚Äî was all handled by AI with minimal human involvement.

Key Findings

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Findings‚Äù
  1. Chinese Models Are Viable: While GLM 4.7 is slightly behind Opus 4.5, it‚Äôs fully capable of app development tasks within the BMAD agile workflow
  2. Significantly Lower Costs: Compared to Opus 4.5, GLM 4.7 costs only about 1/7th
  3. Remarkable Efficiency: From idea to App Store submission in just 12 days
  4. Quality Assured: 15,190 lines of code, all integration tests passing

The Future of Vibe Coding

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Future of Vibe Coding‚Äù

The era of AI autonomous app development has arrived. With a good idea and mature AI toolchains (Claude Code + BMAD + LLMs), anyone can quickly turn ideas into reality.

Life is compounding. Build your pet bond with AI today!

Related Reading:

  • Hands-on Review: Building HeartPetBond App with Claude Code + BMAD + GLM-4.7
  • MoneyMind App Development Journey

item.title: MoneyMind App Approved: AI-Autonomous Development Passes Apple Store Review
item.content:encoded:
The journey of MoneyMind (ÁúÅÈí±ÊÄùÁª¥) from concept to App Store approval‚Äîa testament to AI-autonomous software development powered by Claude Code, BMAD V6, and Flutter MCP.

Ready for Distribution: A Small Victory

Section titled ‚ÄúReady for Distribution: A Small Victory‚Äù

This morning, I logged into App Store Connect and noticed something special: the App status had changed from the yellow ‚ÄúWaiting for Review‚Äù dot to a green ‚ÄúReady for Submit‚Äù indicator.

A moment of excitement‚ÄîClaude Code + BMAD V6 + Flutter MCP had enabled AI to autonomously develop the MoneyMind savings mindset app, which had now passed Apple‚Äôs official review and was ready for release.

The Review Journey: 14 Days, 4 Submissions

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Review Journey: 14 Days, 4 Submissions‚Äù

The journey began in early November, with sporadic development continuing through early December. Finally, just before Christmas Eve, the app was submitted for App Store review.

Challenges Faced

Section titled ‚ÄúChallenges Faced‚Äù

As a first-time App submission, the review process was particularly rigorous:

  • Stricter review forÈ¶ñÊ¨°Êèê‰∫§ - First-time app submissions undergo more intensive scrutiny
  • Holiday delays - Christmas, year-end, and New Year holidays extended the typical review cycle
  • Screen compatibility issues - Fully AI-autonomous testing missed some screen size compatibility issues, resulting in text overlap and missing features discovered during review
  • Account deletion requirement - App Store required adding account deletion functionality

The Numbers

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Numbers‚Äù
  • December 23: Initial submission
  • 4 submissions to App Store
  • 3 rejections before final approval
  • 14 days from first submission to approval
  • 1 mistaken version submission (human error in the process)

After 14 days and multiple iterations, MoneyMind finally passed Apple‚Äôs official review on its first attempt.

About MoneyMind App

Section titled ‚ÄúAbout MoneyMind App‚Äù

MoneyMind (ÁúÅÈí±ÊÄùÁª¥) is built on a simple philosophy:

Make saving money as engaging as gaming, transforming tedious bookkeeping into goal-oriented, achievement-driven daily actions.

Core Features

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Features‚Äù
  • Savings Goals - Set and track financial targets
  • Daily Savings - Record small daily deposits
  • Streak Tracking - Build consistency through daily check-ins
  • Badges & Achievements - Gamified progress rewards

For detailed development journey, refer to the original MoneyMind development blog.

How to Use MoneyMind

Section titled ‚ÄúHow to Use MoneyMind‚Äù

With approval granted, I wanted to celebrate‚Äîbut first, a real test. I downloaded and installed the app, started a savings plan mode, and set a goal: save an extra 1,000 yuan for investment by January 31st.

Section titled ‚ÄúSetting a Goal‚Äù

Tracking Progress

No lunch today, no Starbucks, 10,000 steps walked‚Äîevery small action counts.

Analytics Dashboard

Vibe Coding Context

Vibe Coding makes AI-assisted app development accessible‚Äîbeginners and any AI agent can work together effectively.

The MoneyMind Challenge

Section titled ‚ÄúThe MoneyMind Challenge‚Äù

The goal was ambitious:

Enable AI to autonomously develop software‚Äîincluding generating code and test code, automatically running UI automated integration tests to verify app functionality. Humans only provide the initial idea, then leave everything to AI with minimal or no human intervention throughout the process.

The Winning Combination

What‚Äôs Next

MoneyMind App Evolution

MoneyMind will continue with AI-autonomous development of new features:

  • Data export functionality

Expanding AI Autonomy

item.title: Agent Flywheel - Transform Your VPS into an AI-Powered Coding Environment in 30 Minutes
item.content:encoded:
Agent Flywheel - Transform Your VPS into an AI-Powered Coding Environment in 30 Minutes

Section titled ‚ÄúAgent Flywheel - Transform Your VPS into an AI-Powered Coding Environment in 30 Minutes‚Äù

From zero to agentic coding in 30 minutes. Transform a fresh cloud server into a fully-configured agentic coding environment with Claude Code, OpenAI Codex, and Google Gemini‚Äîall pre-configured with 30+ modern developer tools. All totally free and open-source.

Agent Flywheel Website | GitHub Repository

Introduction: The Agentic Coding Barrier

Section titled ‚ÄúIntroduction: The Agentic Coding Barrier‚Äù

The rise of AI coding agents like Claude Code, Codex CLI, and Gemini CLI has created a new paradigm in software development. These agents can write production code, debug issues, and architect solutions‚Äîbut only if they have the right environment.

The barrier isn‚Äôt the agents themselves. It‚Äôs the hours of setup required to create an environment where agents can be productive:

  • 3-7 hours of manual setup time
  • VPS configuration, shell customization, runtime installation
  • Agent authentication, coordination tools, safety guardrails
  • Endless troubleshooting when something breaks

Agent Flywheel eliminates this barrier entirely. One command, 30 minutes, fully configured.

What Agent Flywheel Delivers

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat Agent Flywheel Delivers‚Äù

One-Liner Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúOne-Liner Installation‚Äù

That‚Äôs it. The installer handles everything:

  • 30+ Tools Installed: From shell configuration to language runtimes
  • 3 AI Agents: Claude Code, Codex CLI, Gemini CLI‚Äîall pre-configured
  • Idempotent & Safe: Re-run anytime; resumes from where it left off
  • Vibe Mode: Passwordless sudo with dangerous flags for maximum velocity

The Complete Stack

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Complete Stack‚Äù

Agent Flywheel installs everything you need for professional agentic coding:

Shell & Terminal UX

  • zsh + oh-my-zsh + powerlevel10k (modern, fast prompt)
  • lsd, atuin, fzf, zoxide, direnv (modern CLI experience)

Language Runtimes

  • Bun (JavaScript/TypeScript)
  • uv (Python)
  • Rust (Cargo)
  • Go

AI Coding Agents

  • Claude Code CLI (with native installer)
  • Codex CLI (OpenAI)
  • Gemini CLI (Google)

Dev Tools

  • tmux (terminal multiplexer)
  • ripgrep, ast-grep (fast code search)
  • lazygit (Git TUI)
  • neovim, bat, jq, and more

Cloud CLIs

  • HashiCorp Vault
  • Wrangler (Cloudflare)
  • Supabase CLI
  • Vercel CLI

The Dicklesworthstone Stack (8 tools for multi-agent orchestration)

  • NTM (Named Tmux Manager)
  • MCP Agent Mail (agent coordination)
  • UBS (Ultimate Bug Scanner)
  • Beads Viewer (task management)
  • CASS (agent session search)
  • CM (CASS Memory)
  • CAAM (Coding Agent Account Manager)
  • SLB (Simultaneous Launch Button)

Why a VPS for Agentic Coding?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy a VPS for Agentic Coding?‚Äù

Agentic workflows need dedicated compute. Here‚Äôs why:

Not Your Laptop

Section titled ‚ÄúNot Your Laptop‚Äù

AI agents consume significant RAM and CPU. Running them locally drains your battery and slows everything down. Each agent uses ~2GB RAM‚Äîwith 10+ agents, you need 48-64GB, more than most laptops have.

Not AWS/GCP/Azure

Section titled ‚ÄúNot AWS/GCP/Azure‚Äù

Cloud giants charge by the hour with unpredictable billing. A dedicated VPS is simpler and cheaper. A 64GB VPS costs ~$40-56/month flat‚Äîequivalent cloud resources would cost 3-5x more.

Works While You Sleep

Section titled ‚ÄúWorks While You Sleep‚Äù

Your VPS runs 24/7. Queue up tasks before bed, wake up to completed code. AI agents can refactor, test, and iterate autonomously‚Äîcompounding progress overnight.

The Interactive Wizard

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Interactive Wizard‚Äù

Agent Flywheel includes a step-by-step wizard website at agent-flywheel.com that guides complete beginners through:

  1. Installing a terminal on your local machine
  2. Generating SSH keys for secure access
  3. Renting a VPS from providers like OVH or Contabo
  4. Connecting via SSH
  5. Running the installer
  6. Starting to code with AI agents

The wizard provides:

  • OS Detection: Auto-detects Mac vs Windows for tailored instructions
  • Copy-to-Clipboard: One-click copy for all commands
  • Progress Tracking: Resume where you left off across browser sessions
  • Troubleshooting: Expandable help for common issues

Vibe Mode: Maximum Velocity

Section titled ‚ÄúVibe Mode: Maximum Velocity‚Äù

Vibe mode is designed for throwaway VPS environments where velocity matters more than safety:

  • Passwordless sudo eliminates friction
  • Agent dangerous flags skip confirmation dialogs
  • Pre-configured aliases for maximum speed

Warning: Never use vibe mode on production or shared systems. It‚Äôs intentionally insecure for velocity‚Äîuse only on ephemeral VPS instances you can rebuild if needed.

The Agentic Coding Flywheel Philosophy

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Agentic Coding Flywheel Philosophy‚Äù

Agent Flywheel isn‚Äôt just a collection of tools‚Äîit‚Äôs a carefully curated system where each component amplifies the others. The value is multiplicative, not additive.

Multi-Agent Orchestration

Section titled ‚ÄúMulti-Agent Orchestration‚Äù

The Dicklesworthstone Stack enables workflows that would otherwise be impossible:

  • NTM spawns 10 agents in named tmux windows with one command
  • Agent Mail coordinates via messaging and file reservations
  • SLB provides two-person rule for dangerous operations
  • Beads Viewer gives agents task visibility

This enables 10 agents working in parallel without stepping on each other‚Äîsomething that would take a solo developer a week, accomplished in one day.

Cost Breakdown

Section titled ‚ÄúCost Breakdown‚Äù

Complete transparency about what you‚Äôll actually pay each month:

ComponentMonthly Cost
Cloud VPS (64GB RAM)$40‚Äì56
Claude Max$200
ChatGPT Pro$200
Total$440‚Äì656/month

Compare this to a junior developer at $5,000+/month. For under $700, you get 10+ AI agents working 24/7, writing code while you sleep.

Installation Modes

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation Modes‚Äù
ModePasswordless SudoAgent FlagsBest For
vibeYes--dangerously-skip-permissionsThrowaway VPS, maximum velocity
safeNoStandard confirmationsProduction-like environments

Verification & Health Checks

Section titled ‚ÄúVerification & Health Checks‚Äù

After installation, verify everything with:

This performs comprehensive health checks on:

  • Identity (user, sudo)
  • Shell configuration
  • Core tools (bun, uv, rust, go)
  • AI agents (claude, codex, gemini)
  • Cloud CLIs (vault, wrangler, supabase, vercel)
  • Dicklesworthstone stack tools

Getting Started

Section titled ‚ÄúGetting Started‚Äù

For Beginners

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Beginners‚Äù

Visit agent-flywheel.com and follow the 13-step wizard. It guides you from ‚ÄúI have a laptop‚Äù to ‚ÄúAI agents are coding for me.‚Äù

For Developers

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Developers‚Äù

Run the one-liner on a fresh Ubuntu VPS:

After installation, run the interactive tutorial:

For Teams

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Teams‚Äù

ACFS provides reproducible, idempotent setup‚Äîensuring every team member‚Äôs VPS environment is identical, eliminating ‚Äúworks on my machine‚Äù for agentic workflows.

The Vision Behind Agent Flywheel

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Vision Behind Agent Flywheel‚Äù

I built Agent Flywheel because I was being inundated with requests from friends, relatives, and strangers asking me to help them get started with using AI for software development.

I wanted one resource I could point people to that would help them ‚Äúfrom soup to nuts‚Äù in getting set up‚Äîeven if they have almost no computer expertise, just motivation and desire.

This is also a platform to share my suite of totally free, open-source agentic coding tools‚Äîoriginally built for my consulting work with Private Equity and Hedge Funds, now available to help others be more productive and creative too.

Links

Section titled ‚ÄúLinks‚Äù
  • Website: agent-flywheel.com
  • GitHub: Dicklesworthstone/agentic_coding_flywheel_setup
  • Author: Jeffrey Emanuel (@Dicklesworthstone)

Transform how you code. Let AI agents write production code while you focus on intent, architecture, and quality.

item.title: Notes on AI Apps in 2026: Thinking Tools vs Making Tools
item.content:encoded:
Notes on AI Apps in 2026

Section titled ‚ÄúNotes on AI Apps in 2026‚Äù

Source: @illscience | Published: January 5, 2026

Introduction

Section titled ‚ÄúIntroduction‚Äù

Following excellent 2025 roundup pieces from Karpathy and Simon Willison, Anish Acharya shares his thoughts on what 2026 holds for AI apps. The ecosystem is maturing in expected and surprising ways‚Äîwe‚Äôve figured out how to make code cheap, but it hasn‚Äôt yet diffused across enterprises or the world as implied by those lower costs. We haven‚Äôt realized even 10% of what this means for how companies get built and what software will exist.

Thinking Tools vs Making Tools

Section titled ‚ÄúThinking Tools vs Making Tools‚Äù

One major shift expected in 2026 is the nature of tools themselves. All current knowledge work tools focus on execution:

  • IDEs for creating code
  • Figma for creating design
  • Spreadsheets for creating models

When it comes to tools for exploration‚Äîtools that help us think‚Äîwe don‚Äôt really have any modern products outside of LLMs themselves emerging as thinking partners.

The Fundamental Problem Shift

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Fundamental Problem Shift‚Äù

As coding agents work with increasing accuracy and longer time horizons, the hard problem moves from:

‚ÄúHow do I build it?‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúWhat do I build?‚Äù

You can imagine a near-future PM who sets broad goals for their AI and wakes up every morning to review 2-3 features the model dreamt up, executed on, and A/B tested overnight. However, current models still struggle with deciding what to build next‚Äîthe ideas are bland, derivative, and lack the spark seen in truly innovative product thinking.

The Rise of Exploration-First Tools

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Rise of Exploration-First Tools‚Äù

The spiritual successors of coding, design, and productivity tools will focus on exploration vs execution:

  • Coding tools are already leading‚ÄîCursor is furthest along
  • Antigravity is interesting as ‚Äúagent-first‚Äù (exploration first) in product design

Software Eats All ‚ÄúService‚Äù Functions

Section titled ‚ÄúSoftware Eats All ‚ÄúService‚Äù Functions‚Äù

A critical distinction in software companies:

  • Power functions (engineering/product/performance marketing): closer to software
  • Service functions (legal/finance/HR): further from software, more human-capital levered

Two Implications of Coding Agents

Section titled ‚ÄúTwo Implications of Coding Agents‚Äù

1. Every team should be software-first All teams (marketing, legal, procurement, finance) must reach for a software toolbox before traditional process/human systems. Options include:

  • Domain-specific products (like Harvey for legal)
  • ‚ÄúBare metal‚Äù coding agents (Codex, Claude Code)

Every team should be a software team.

2. Enterprises can be dramatically more ambitious An enterprise producing software can be dramatically more ambitious in what they produce. The entire ideation/prioritization pipeline must reboot to accommodate this. Every feature that can be built will be built‚Äîmost enterprises aren‚Äôt ready for this reality.

‚ÄúThe culture change problem will be as hard as the organizational change problem.‚Äù

Compounding AI Apps

Section titled ‚ÄúCompounding AI Apps‚Äù

Entering year two of reasoning models, expect continued divergence between AI-native apps and AI models. Apps will combine:

  • Orchestration of cutting-edge models
  • Domain-specific UI
  • Extensive feature surface (now very cheap to build)

This is the natural implication of ‚ÄúNarrow Startups‚Äù‚Äîextraordinary specialization is now possible.

Why Apps Won‚Äôt Be Subsumed by Models

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy Apps Won‚Äôt Be Subsumed by Models‚Äù

Labs and big tech are about as ‚Äújagged‚Äù in their capabilities as the models they produce‚Äîformidable in focus areas but with:

  • Complex commitments (e.g., Google‚Äôs commitments to regulators)
  • Hard prioritization problems (OpenAI simultaneously competing as consumer, enterprise, model, and hardware company)

Even in domains central to model progress like coding, we see a thriving ecosystem‚Äîstartups generated >$1B of new revenue in 2025 alone.

The ‚ÄúThick‚Äù AI App Framework

Section titled ‚ÄúThe ‚ÄúThick‚Äù AI App Framework‚Äù

Combining insights:

  • Multi-model orchestration
  • Autonomy slider
  • Context engineering
  • Cornered data resources
  • Network products
  • Ecosystems with extensive feature surface

This is what mature AI apps look like.

Humans Discover ‚Äúthe Rest‚Äù of AI

Section titled ‚ÄúHumans Discover ‚Äúthe Rest‚Äù of AI‚Äù

Eugenia has been the best thinker on how the command-line UI has held back everyday consumers from AI‚Äôs best capabilities. This is changing:

  • Wabi: Exposing code generation to consumers
  • Images tab in ChatGPT/Grok: Same for image generation
  • Apps Directory and Skills: Will do the same for MCPs and prompt plugins

Generating a tiny app in 2025 was as delightful as generating a poem in 2023‚Äîbut most consumers still don‚Äôt know this exists.

Notes for (Incumbent) CEOs

Section titled ‚ÄúNotes for (Incumbent) CEOs‚Äù

For CEOs already at scale, navigating the AI transition:

  1. Look at best-in-class examples of how models collapse all customer-facing roles (sales, support, collections) into a single function with a broad goal

  2. Embrace being software-first in every function‚Äînon-technical functions embracing models is how enterprises get broad operating leverage

  3. Demand more ambitious products and prices‚Äîif Tesla can deliver coast-to-coast FSD and Claude Code can be written with Claude Code, we already have AGI for near-term enterprise purposes

Finally‚Ä¶ Have Fun

Section titled ‚ÄúFinally‚Ä¶ Have Fun‚Äù

‚ÄúNo one tells you that you were living in the good old days until they are gone, so consider this your notice.‚Äù

This product cycle is:

  • Less centralized
  • More software-led
  • Simply more damn fun for technologists than any in recent memory

Explore these new technologies, discuss their implications, and make more new stuff.

Key Takeaways

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Takeaways‚Äù
TrendImplication
Thinking vs Making ToolsFocus shifts from ‚Äúhow to build‚Äù to ‚Äúwhat to build‚Äù
Enterprise TransformationEvery team becomes a software team
Compounding AI AppsApps combine multi-model orchestration with domain-specific UX
Consumer DiscoveryGUIs and app stores democratize AI creation
CEO StrategyDemand more ambitious products‚ÄîAGI is here for practical purposes

References

Section titled ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù
  • Original Thread by @illscience
  • Andrej Karpathy‚Äôs 2025 Roundup
  • Simon Willison‚Äôs 2025 Roundup
  • Narrow Startups Framework

item.title: Optimizing Claude Code Experience with CCometixLine: A High-Performance Rust Statusline
item.content:encoded:
In the rapidly evolving world of AI-assisted development, efficient tooling is paramount. CCometixLine emerges as a powerful solution for developers using Claude Code, offering a high-performance statusline written in Rust that integrates seamlessly with your workflow.

What is CCometixLine?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is CCometixLine?‚Äù

CCometixLine is a statusline tool designed specifically for Claude Code. Built with Rust, it prioritizes performance and reliability while delivering a rich set of features including Git integration, usage tracking, and an interactive Terminal User Interface (TUI) for configuration.

Key Features

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Features‚Äù

CCometixLine enhances your CLI experience with functionalities that go beyond simple status display:

  • Git Integration: View branch status, changes (clean/dirty/conflicts), and remote tracking (ahead/behind) instantly.
  • Model Awareness: Displays simplified Claude model names (e.g., ‚ÄúSonnet 3.5‚Äù) for quick reference.
  • Usage Tracking: Monitors token usage and context window status based on transcript analysis.
  • Interactive TUI: A built-in configuration interface that allows you to customize themes and settings with real-time previews.
  • Robustness: Includes a ‚Äúrobust patcher‚Äù to survive Claude Code version updates and automatic backups.

Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation‚Äù

Getting started with CCometixLine is straightforward. You can install it via npm or download binaries directly.

via npm

Section titled ‚Äúvia npm‚Äù

Manual Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúManual Installation‚Äù

For those who prefer binaries or don‚Äôt use npm, you can download the latest release from the GitHub repository for Linux, macOS, or Windows.

Configuration

Section titled ‚ÄúConfiguration‚Äù

One of the standout features of CCometixLine is its Interactive TUI. Simply run:

This opens a visual interface where you can:

  • Select from built-in themes (Minimal, Nord, Gruvbox, etc.).
  • Enable or disable specific segments (Time, Cost, Git, etc.).
  • Customize colors and icons.

Alternatively, you can manually edit the ~/.claude/ccline/config.toml file.

Integrating with Claude Code

Section titled ‚ÄúIntegrating with Claude Code‚Äù

To use CCometixLine as your statusline, update your Claude Code settings.json:

Note: Ensure ccline is in your system PATH, or provide the full path to the executable.

Why Choose CCometixLine?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy Choose CCometixLine?‚Äù

Unlike standard statuslines, CCometixLine is built with Rust, ensuring minimal latency even with complex git operations and transcript analysis. Its rich feature set, combined with the ease of configuration via TUI, makes it an essential tool for power users looking to optimize their daily workflow with Claude Code.

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

CCometixLine represents a significant upgrade to the default Claude Code experience. Whether you need better visibility into your git status, want to track your token usage more effectively, or simply desire a customized aesthetic, CCometixLine delivers on all fronts.

Give it a try and elevate your coding setup today!
